comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: FLAMES SWEEP CONEY ISLAND; Blaze Starts in Dreamland, Spreads Rapidly, and Park Is Soon Wholly Wiped Out. May 27, 1911, Saturday Page 1, 1620 words Like the fire of four years ago which, starting at the west end of the Bowery at Coney Island, burned out Steeplechase Park and all the surrounding amusement enterprises, a blaze started in Dreamland Park at Coney Island some time after midnight last night and, feeding on the flimsy woodwork and paper mache structures which enclose the park, it gained good headway before it was discovered at 2:10 o'clock. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B0DE0D81031E233A...
